intro: Wahlenbergia pumilio, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a low-growing species, often forming dense mats, and is well adapted to arid conditions. Wahlenbergia pumilio is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
